body_html: Found another one that I thought was a bit more insidious and is easy to miss. If you have an HloMap instruction, the computation it references must be serialized in the .proto before the computation that references it, otherwise you get a segfault (order of ids doesn't matter though)
body_text: Found another one that I thought was a bit more insidious and is easy to miss. If you have an HloMap instruction, the computation it references must be serialized in the .proto before the computation that references it, otherwise you get a segfault (order of ids doesn't matter though)
body: Found another one that I thought was a bit more insidious and is easy to miss. If you have an `HloMap` instruction, the computation it references must be serialized in the .proto before the computation that references it, otherwise you get a segfault (order of ids doesn't matter though)
